p: OMEGA‐3 (ω‐3 or n‐3) fatty acids (FA), together with n‐6 FA, are essential polyunsaturated FA important for humans. n‐3 FA are involved in neural development 1, 2 and could be part of a novel therapy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). 3 Today, several invasive methodologies enable the quantification of n‐3 FAs; however, these methods are time‐consuming and costly. 4, 5 Knowledge about the in vivo content and distribution of n‐3 FA in human body tissues is not well established.
